doc.title: FAQs for an EVENT-FULL September
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/FAQs for an EVENT-FULL SeptemberFAQs for an EVENT-FULL September_2025-08-29

passages.text: Unsurprisingly Al, Rates, Macros, Capital Allocation & more are going to be hot topics during a very busy September of events laid out below. We start with the CB Forum (9/3- 5), followed by Barclays' GFSC (9/8- 10), and then with a bunch of NDRs and events sprinkled throughout the month.

In other words, while summer is winding down, BIPS is only heating up - with September shaping up to be another 'event- full' one. Please see our respective FAQs (in a more 'scrollable' format this year for easier use in meetings) as you prepare for the upcoming events listed below. We welcome any questions ahead of these events.

- A unique opportunity to hear from the C-teams of EFX, FICO, TRU, EXPN, and FA. While these sessions will be virtual moderated sessions, for those looking for 1:1's, keep in mind that most of these names will be attending in-person the following week at our GFSC as well (more below).- And complemented well by in-person meetings with Mike McLean (Barclays U.S. Policy analyst) for dinner 9/3 and Nova Credit (private company; not covered) for lunch 9/4.- We will also be hosting a takeaway lunch on 9/5; for those interested please do reach out.

- Here EFX, TRU, EXPN, and FA will all be returning for fireside chats and in-person meetings (EFX and EXPN 1x1 online).- We also will also be hosting other C-teams from MSCI, SPGI, and VRSK.- For our initial takeaways from GFSC, please join the keynote lunch in-person on 9/10 (from 12-1pm) which will feature all the Barclays Global Financial Services Equity Research Analysts. The next day on 9/11, also @ noon is another call for detailed takeaways and outlook as well by the entire team (for APAC clients we will be doing a BIPS focused call at 8pm ET on 9/11). You will also find us at the GFSC Cocktail Reception after Day 1 on 9/8 @ 5pm.
Please see analyst certifications and important disclosures beginning on page 86. Completed: 29- Aug- 25, 02:03 GMT Released: 29- Aug- 25, 04:10 GMT Restricted - External
U.S. Business & Professional Services NEUTRAL Unchanged

- Lastly, we are hosting a group lunch with Alex Matturri, former CEO of S&P Dow Jones Indices, at 12pm on 9/12 
- for his key takeaways from the financial conference.
- NYC NDRs w/ CFO + IR for:
- IT on 9/4/25; and- TRI on 9/30/25
- Hold for Barclays' Market Data Insights call on 9/15 @ 11am ET.

- INTU IR Day on 9/18 
- We will look out for any CB-related insight and takeaways; particularly from its Credit Karma division;

- RELX Head of IR Lunch in NYC on 9/18 
- Will be interesting to hear what RELX says re: legal competition with TRI and end market adoption of AI offerings; and

- FDS F4Q'25 Earnings 
- FDS will be missing from the meeting circuit but should be reporting towards the end of September (last year was 9/19/24) given its August fiscal year end. It will be the first earnings call with new CEO Sanoke Viswanathan in charge, and we will be curious to see how he chooses to set up FY26e guidance. Two key questions: 1) how conservative will ASV be set-up, similar to this year or will he try to outline an acceleration and 2) will he need to take margins down to undergo an investment cycle (something we have highlighted for the past 12+ months)?

- ECL's biennial IR Day on 9/4 in MN... where based on Insights from IR Breakfast & Call-Backs (08/06/25), it sounds like ECL will double down on its commitment not only to +12-15% EPS growth, but also to at least +100 bps of margin expansion for at least the next couple of years to achieve its long awaited 20% OI target. Beyond what we highlighted in our 2Q25 note (Ecolab Inc.: Executing, but in muddy waters; IR Day Next, 07/29/25), ECL's IR Day will have emphasis on high-growth areas (on "fire" Hi-tech & One ECL & Digital) and immersive/experiential elements for investors. There will be segment specifics such as Pest Intelligence innovation, and impacts of implementation on margins & growth. We thought ECL Acquiring Ovivo's Electronics ultra-pure water business a potentially smart step, 08/13/25 
- this acquisition & broader portfolio management and M&A pipeline will undoubtedly be areas of interest for investors.

- CTAS's F1Q'25 EPS 
- CTAS is off-cycle (with a 5/31 FY end), with an earnings call likely towards the end of the month (was 9/25/24 last year). For F1Q'25 we expect continued effective execution, and that once again Results highlight superiority (07/17/25).
- Note: UNF's F4Q24 and FY24 earnings aren't expected until mid-October.
- KLC NDR on 9/30 in Boston (and NYC on 10/1) for meetings with CEO and CFO, + IR team.

(MSCI) - When will end market pressure subside, or is a new growth opportunity needed? 36  FactSet (FDS) - Investments + new CEO enough to stave off competitive and AI pressure? 41  Verisk (VRSK) - Strong growth drivers in place for coming years; capital allocation steady for now 45  Thomson Reuters (TRI) - How high can AI drive growth acceleration? 48  Gartner (IT) - AI loser or high quality compounder at a discount? 52  First Advantage (FA) - Hiring happening despite labor market/macro headlines? 56  Cintas (CTAS) - Consistently excellent execution to continue? 63  Ecolab (ECL) - Confident & committed to 12- 15% EPS growth; IR Day a catalyst? 68  Kindercare (KLC) - lessons learnt on life as a public co.? 79
Model + Recent Notes:

- EFX Model- Equifax Inc.: Disappointing Gov't commentary (yet again) after solid 2Q, Manav Patnaik, 07/22/25- FICO/EFX/TRU: Initial thoughts on Tweeting Tuesday, Manav Patnaik, 07/08/25- Equifax Inc. Reconfirming confidence in delivering the LT growth framework..., Manav Patnaik, 6/17/25

- Lending environment & FY25 guide 
- Provide some of the key moving pieces you are seeing by lending category. What are your assumptions in your guide and how has activity been relative to that? What are lenders saying about the impacts of continued elevated inflation and their appetite for marketing and lending from here?

- EWS Government 
- Discuss the recent contracts you have extended or signed (incl. SSA and state agency level)? How much of growth is re-pricing of existing contracts vs. pricing escalators within contracts vs. new contracts with states/departments? How does Records growth benefit Government specifically?

- OBBBA impacts 
- What changes in the bill will impact state's reimbursements or verification requirements, and therefore could impact your services or contract scope? I.e. any positive tailwind from more income verifications required (e.g. 2x per year vs. 1x)? Any impact from adding work requirements to CMS or stricter error rate expectations? How do error rates impact federal subsidies that states receive? How much does TWN lower error rates?

- States using alternative data 
- Risk of states using data they already own (like state wage or tax data) or other alternative sources to pull TWN less or cancel contracts?

- Medicaid data cost reimbursements 
- Describe the impact to your state clients and EWS from the change in federal reimbursements? How much revenue impact from states that have chosen to not use EWS (for now) as a result of this change? Progress on signing states to refreshed contracts after these changes?

- Records 
- Where should we expect Records to grow in 2025? Beyond 2025? Where will it plateau as a % of non-farm payrolls? How does the Records growth translate in your different end markets (i.e. 1-to-1? 50% less?).

- Workday Partnership 
- Describe the 'strategic partnership' with Workday and how it compares to other arrangements EFX has with payroll providers? Have most of the Workday-related records been added now? Economics and exclusivity of this deal? Since they are an aggregator that works with many providers, how will that impact the net new records EFX can add? How much do you expect the 'opt-in' arrangement to impact the amount of net new records EFX accesses?

- Mortgage 
- Can you describe your levers of outperformance vs. volumes for EWS (records, pricing, mix/NPI)? Can you describe your levers of outperformance vs. volumes for EWS (records, pricing,mix/NPI) and USIS? Does EWS have any further penetration opportunity in

mortgage? What % of the market uses 36- month EWS data now (or \(>\) active record), and how much more does a 36- month pull cost than just an active record pull? How is progress on converting customers over, or has it been stable in recent quarters? What is the full suite of products and price points now after recent launches? How much should EFX outperform in a normalized LSD volume growth mortgage market? How does Records growth translate to Mortgage growth specifically?

- USIS Mortgage 
- Can you describe your levers of outperformance vs. volumes for USIS? Progress with market share gains with pre-screen single file? How does TWN indicator factor into that? Any share changes for tri-merge reselling? Impacts from Congress moving to ban trigger leads?

- VantageScore 
- With VS now accepted by GSEs, how will you think about go-to market for VS scores vs. FICO scores? What's the difference in what you charge for a file with VS vs. FICO across mortgage, auto, and any other areas? Is the infrastructure in place for the mortgage market to actually accept VS throughout the system (i.e. lenders, GSEs, MBS investors)?

- TWN indicator 
- How does the indicator work and why won't it cannibalize TWN pulls? How has testing gone with banks? Do you think you can gain share with pre-screen/soft pulls due to the TWN indicator?

- EWS Talent 
- What growth/decline are you seeing in hiring volumes from your existing BG screening customers (i.e. 'same store sales')? How much of growth is from Records, Penetration, and Pricing? Can you quantify it? Is there much of a market today for I&E verifications in high volume blue collar/service jobs, where your newer product is trying to target; or are you trying to establish the market? How does Records growth benefit Talent specifically vs. other markets (i.e. more historical record reliance)?

- Pricing 
- Discuss how your pricing pass-through and mark-up works for the FICO score? About how much do you charge for the scoring, and how much is that as a % of the overall cost of a mortgage file (w/ score)?

- FinTech 
- Discuss the opportunity to further penetrate this channel. What % of your exposure is EWS vs. USIS? What products does EFX have and how does it differ from a traditional lender? How quickly do you expect it to grow in a normalized market, and how much has it declined since its peak? How is the competitive environment given TRU has a clear lead here (at least on the CB side)?

- ID & Fraud 
- Recent chargeback headwinds for Midigator, where are we now?

- System-to-system and waterfalls 
- Explain how your customer interaction/economics are different between clients who do and do not have system-to-system integration and top of waterfall?

- USIS Commercial 
- Has seen solid growth, is EFX taking share from established players or having success with NPI? Some other driver? What offerings do you have?

- USIS Consumer 
- Has performed very well the last several quarters even though your competitors have seen more muted activity, why is that? Where do you play in this space relative to the other bureaus? What are your offerings in this space

- Litigation expenses 
- Can you identify what drove incremental litigation expenses in 2025? Why didn't other CBs call out similar impacts?

- 2030 Framework 
- How does EFX build up to \(8 - 9\%\) organic growth with 'normal' LSD mortgage growth? How does EFX get back to \(35\%\) margin in that scenario given margin declines in recent years (i.e. without the help from mortgage recovery)? Views on buyback vs. M&A as FCF improves?

- Mortgage recovery 
- What are the impacts of a mortgage revenue recovery on revenue, EBITDA (i.e. incremental margins on mortgage revenue), and EPS? Describe how you get to \(\)4+\(/sh. EPS of mortgage upside you've highlighted, and how that number could change over time, especially given pricing? Your data shows originations are now running closer to 30-35% below 2015-2019 average, does that limit the EPS upside since inquiries have been running below originations for a while due to industry dynamics?

- Workforce Solutions (EWS) 
- What are your levers to outperform across every EWS end market? How much can you outperform on the downside vs. on the upside? How do you build to the 13-15% long-term growth model? And what needs to happen to get back to that growth level? Have you reconsidered pricing strategy given competitive and customer "noise"? Since record growth and therefore outperformance vs. volumes will eventually slow a bit over time, what would the L-T financial model be in a more mature setting? Would you lean more on pricing? Competition in the space long-term from start-ups and EXPN?

- EWS Government 
- Any large state departments where EFX currently does not have a big presence but feel that you can over the next few years?

- Appriss 
- How does this strategic bolt-on strengthen the Workforce Solutions business and further the plan to build out a comprehensive Workforce Data Solutions hub?

- USIS 
- How much of USIS growth is driven by product and price vs. pure volume? How often does share change between competitors (and describe how customers tier CBs for where they send volume)? What are potential tangible revenue benefits over time for going full cloud (and cost benefits)?

- ID & Fraud 
- Discuss EFX's opportunity in the digital identity & fraud prevention market with \(\)19B\(TAM, teens annual growth? What does the product/offering suite look like after acquisitions in recent years

- International bureaus 
- Any countries that you would like to expand in or get into, or assets that you would like to own? Any countries you generally avoid

- L-T Vision 
- What is the L-T vision for the EFX cloud and EWS Data Hub and all the differentiated data assets EFX has recently acquired?

- Buybacks 
- What is your view on buybacks right now given current valuation and your other priorities?

- M&A 
- What is your acquisition strategy? What kinds of assets are you looking for, and size? How do you balance this with buybacks/dividend?

- CapEx 
- Could you provide an update on Cap-ex expectations over time with cloud investment winding down and data center shutdowns? How much cash flow should that free up in 2025 and 2026?

- FICO Model- Fair Isaac Corp.: Takeaways from CEO Call-Back & CFO NDR, Manav Patnaik, 08/06/25- Fair Isaac Corp. Strong F3Q led by Scores; CEO defends FICO Score after FHFA decision, Manav Patnaik, 7/30/25- Fair Isaac Corp.: The latest Bull-Bear debate on 'Lenders Choice', Manav Patnaik, 07/21/25

- How are your conversations with the FHFA (if there are any) given the public rhetoric from Director Bill Pulte?- Does it impact how you think about your future pricing?- Is "no infrastructure changes" really possible if GSEs are accepting VS?

- Will the mortgage industry use VS now that GSEs are accepting it?- Feedback from MBS ecosystem and lenders?- Do you think there will be a risk premium priced into VS-scored paper relative to FICO?- Predictiveness of FICO Classic vs. FICO 10T vs. VS 4.0? Can you comment on different studies that have been done by VS, FICO, and third parties?- Adverse selection risk, how is the market thinking about that?- Backwards compatibility of VS 4.0 and FICO 10T with FICO Classic?- Share vs. VS in Auto and other non-mortgage categories?

- Scores Pricing 
- How do you think about pricing benefit relative to the guide? What is baked into numbers from a pricing perspective? What is driving your thought process for next year's rate card, especially for Mortgage but also for Auto?

- Lending Volumes 
- Can you provide some of the key moving pieces you are seeing by category (Mortgage, Auto, and Card/PL)? What are your assumptions looking like and what's the update on the lending volume recovery for each?

- B2C 
- How big is the partner business, and how much is through EXPN and CK? Are there any other notable partnerships? How closely does your B2C revenue growth match EXPN's Consumer revenue growth? Describe the myFICO offering, and how big is myFICO today? How is FICO trending with incremental marketing spend that was highlighted this year

- Tri-merge to bi-merge 
- How would the proposed change impact your business, and do you expect the change to commence in late 2025 as proposed by the regulators?

- Origination mix 
- Exposure to Card vs. Auto vs. Mortgage vs. other/PL? Recent trends for all categories? How much pricing do you typically take in non mortgage categories? How can mix shift between quarters?

- Other B2B Scores 
- What are the components/mix of non-origination B2B Scores revenue (i.e. account mgmt., marketing, int'l license, other license, etc.)? Any key drivers or tough/easy comps for FY26?

- Software Pipeline 
- How do you bridge your Platform ARR growth back to 30%+ as you've outlined? Are FIG's tech investments accelerating or slowing? Is your new business more "land" or "expand" right now? Is there any migration from non platform to platform right now, or is that down the road?

- Software Product mix 
- What is the mix between Originations Manager, CCS, Triad, Strategy Director, Falcon, etc.?

- 30% EPS CAGR 
- Is that still sustainable given the pressure on pricing? Is 20% EPS growth a reasonable floor if volumes are weak? How do you bridge to 30% EPS growth if you price less in mortgage, or is that necessary to get there?

- B2B Scores 
- How long can the pricing runway go, especially for mortgage? How should we think about the runway for mortgage pricing from here (i.e. % of tri-merge bundle, % of closing costs etc.)? Do pockets with significant pricing upside potential remain outside of mortgage? How have customers responded to recent price increases, especially mortgage?
- Differences in pricing between mortgage and other categories? How do you expect your category specific pricing to change over time (i.e. where is there more upside vs. less)?

- B2C Scores 
- How tied is it to the mortgage market (especially myFICO)? Split between myFICO and partner business and how that should trend long-term? Any other sizable partner opportunities out there?

- FICO Score XD (alternative data) and UltraFICO (consumer-permissioned data) 
- Can either of these be material drivers over time? If so, how?

- FICO Score international 
- Can you talk about the financial inclusion initiatives FICO has in some emerging markets? FICO has been the dominant score in the US for years, but it hasn't really translated into a greater international footprint for Scores. Any way that could change in the future?

- Software Growth/margin trajectory 
- How does FICO think about long-term normalized growth & margin targets? Any color on efficiency efforts within Software (i.e. development costs, standardization, cloud architecture), or eventual efficiencies as the business matures over time? What are the key areas of investment? Migration from non platform to platform over time? Will some offerings be forced onto the platform at some point? Which ones and when?

- Progress in selling legacy brands/IP on Platform 
- Discuss key products (Originations Manager, CCS, Triad, Strategy Director, Falcon, etc.), and how the transition has progressed, both from a technology and a sales perspective?

- Amazon Web Services 
- FICO chose AWS as its web cloud provider. Provide some background on how that decision was made, and what it means practically for the future of FICO's SaaS platform.

- Expanding Platform beyond bank customers 
- What sectors have the most potential for the FICO Software Platform to expand more beyond banks? What product uses/end markets seem to be getting the most traction?

- Software Competition 
- How does your product differ from EXPN's Powercurve? What is the expected impact from the likes of Salesforce.com and Oracle stepping up with a more aggressive analytic cloud effort?

- Portfolio rationalization 
- FICO has already sold a few small Software businesses in recent years. Are there any other areas that no longer make sense to be in? Or would you re-consider the value of having Scores and Software together?

- Buybacks 
- FICO has consistently poured most of its FCF into buybacks. Is that still the plan and would that ever change?

- Lending environment & FY25 guide 
- Provide some of the key moving pieces you are seeing by lending category. What are your assumptions in your guide and how has activity been relative to that? What are lenders saying about the impacts of continued elevated inflation and their appetite for marketing and lending from here?

- FinTech 
- FinTech lending doing very well in 1H25, how are things tracking? How do customers sound with potential rate cuts on the horizon? Will they pull back if cuts are pushed out?

- Mortgage 
- Can you describe your levers of outperformance vs. volumes? Market share with pre-screen single file seems to be strong, can that continue (and any way to quantify)? Impacts from Congress moving to ban trigger leads?

- VantageScore 
- With VS now accepted by GSEs, how will you think about go-to market for VS scores vs. FICO scores? What's the difference in what you charge for a file with VS vs. FICO across mortgage, auto, and any other areas? Is the infrastructure in place for the mortgage market to actually accept VS throughout the system (i.e. lenders, GSEs, MBS investors)?

- OneTRU & transformation initiatives 
- Describe your recent cost-efficiency/investment program, what is the goal? How are the cost savings being achieved and what has been achieved to date? How will it lead to stronger revenue growth over time? How best to track this progress for investors?

- Neustar/Marketing 
- How is your progress with re-accelerating growth? Any milestones achieved? How important is OneTRU to drive acceleration here?

- TCS 
- Has grown really well since the acquisition, how long can this strong growth continue or do you anticipate a normalization?

- Insurance 
- How is insurance trending and how has activity changed as the hard market of recent years has finally started to soften?

- International 
- What are growth drivers for your developed market bureaus? Describe what led to your recent share gains in Canada? Where are your highest growth emerging market bureaus and what drives those bureaus (i.e. how does product mix differ from U.S. Markets)? Are Fraud and Marketing as relevant to your International growth playbook, or is that more of a U.S. story?

- India 
- Growth has slowed recently but you plan for a 2H acceleration into the teens, what drove the recent slowdown and now the acceleration? Where do you see normalized growth after a really strong run pre-2025? What is the margin profile of India relative to the
rest of your Int'l businesses? Any other EM opportunities that could be the next India (even if at a smaller scale)?

- Other Emerging Verticals 
- Talk through the moving pieces in the different channels (collections, public sector, tenant/employment screening, telco, etc.)?

- Consumer Interactive 
- Talk about the dynamics in direct vs. indirect channels right now? Also discuss what Sontiq does and how it can maintain its solid growth profile over time? Strategy to return overall segment to better growth?

- Argus 
- How does TRU plan to accelerate growth, and what was wrong with the business when you acquired it?

- OneTRU 
- What is the ultimate goal of OneTRU? How will the company be different after the investments, and how would this show in the P&L over time?

- Neustar/Marketing 
- Do you still expect growth to ramp into \(10\% +\) , or is it more of a HSD opportunity? How tied is the business to e-commerce activity, directly or indirectly? How should we think about the L-T growth, specifically by product (Marketing, Fraud, Communication)?

- Insurance 
- Has grown as high as DD historically, where do you expect growth to normalize and why?

- FinTech 
- TRU is a clear leader here, why is that and what is the ultimate opportunity? How much opportunity is there to sell Neustar/ID services into the vertical?

- Trended data 
- Talk about penetration in this space, and how much runway remains. Are there opportunities to take the 'trended' concept to other TRU databases?

- Prama 
- Describe the product, and how does TRU differentiate this product from competitors?

- India 
- You have targeted a \(20\% +\) CAGR through 2025 and have been easily exceeding that despite a recent slowdown; how large is the foreseeable opportunity there, and how long would it take to get there? How much of the growth opportunity is product relative to market growth and other sources?

- New growth verticals 
- Any verticals worth highlighting as incremental growth opportunities that investors don't talk about (especially ones where M&A could help)?

- International M&A 
- Any there other developed or emerging markets where you might have an interest in expanding eventually?

- Debt pay down vs. buybacks vs. M&A 
- What are you prioritizing as we look out over the next couple years? How do you view current valuation?

- Sustainability & Climate run rate 
- When will it re-accelerate, or is this the new normal (i.e. MSD-HSD)? How much of your revenue (ex-Index) is scoring vs. other data/analytics?

- Climate 
- Discuss MSCI's role in the investment ecosystem in addressing climate change and how the company is positioned to be the premier provider of tools for portfolio decisions related to climate. What are the high level trends in terms of client needs & solutions: Asset owners & managers, Wealth, Insurance + more. What are your offerings within Climate specifically?

- SFDR 
- What is the opportunity presented by SFDR in the EU, which imposes mandatory ESG disclosure obligations on asset managers and other financial market participants?

- Private Assets 
- RCA has slowed in recent years, how has that space been impacted by the pandemic and when should we expect to see a recovery? Is it worth competing with CoStar here or is it better to focus on Burgiss and the private capital opportunity? How will Burgiss grow 
-20% given some challenges in the end market? What is proprietary about Burgiss? How does it synergize with your existing capabilities?

- MCO partnership (Private Credit + ESG) 
- Describe your recently announced partnership with MCO, what is each side bringing to the table and what gap is it filling for MSCI? How much of net new ESG growth has been driven by the partnership? Is your goal to leverage MCO's distribution with your IP? How can investors track the progress of the private credit partnership (MSCI Burgiss + MCO EDF-X)?

- Index subscription 
- What's the long-term strategy to get back to \(10\%\) growth, or is it even possible given active-to-passive and fund launch trends? Can MSCI lean on pricing more or is that potentially dangerous and opening the door to more competition?

- Index ABF 
- How much can inflows sustainably add to base AUMs in a year (i.e. MSD%, HSD%)? L-T outlook for secular trends, active-to-passive & fee rate charged for asset-based fees?

- Custom Index 
- Describe MSCI's competitive advantage in this space, why is your business so much larger and faster-growing than Index competitors? How do you maintain that most?

- Sustainability & Climate 
- When will you update the long-term target? How big is the Climate opportunity relative to ESG? Do you expect Europe and APAC to grow at higher rates than the U.S. permanently? How mature is the ESG part of the business now?

- Downturn Playbook 
- Can you talk about asset-based fees as a driver of downturn playbook and what focus areas for expense management? Would you push off any planned investments? If so, where would those investments be?

- Threat from the exchange providers 
- Views on providers such as ICE and NDAQ, which are looking to bolster their data capabilities?

- ISaaS 
- MSCI is transitioning to modular component-based analytics products, integrated through APIs as part of an enterprise-wide integrated Investment Solutions-as-a-Service (ISaaS) offering. Does this help revenue growth over time?

- Investments 
- Talk about the key areas of investment focus and investment and the levels of internal investment? How much investment is focused on Sustainability/Climate or Private Markets vs. the more mature Index and Analytics businesses?

- Leverage 
- L-T leverage target? Why and how much flexibility?

- Share repurchases 
- Dependent on cash availability and a function of share price volatility and value, what is a multiple range at which share repurchases would make sense?

- M&A focus 
- Private Assets (esp. credit/equity) seem to be the most attractive area where MSCI operates today but is sub-scale. Following the RCA and Burgiss acquisitions, what could be other potential focus areas? What capabilities or characteristics: unique or proprietary data, analytics, software?

- New CEO initiatives

- What are you seeing across regions, client types, and product areas right now? Are we approaching an inflection point where growth can accelerate? How is bank hiring setting up for fall 2025 and 2026, especially with better M&A in recent months?

- Competition 
- What's your current assessment of the competitive landscape, are the competitive dynamics getting harder? Some of your peers have talked about aggressive discounting in the Desktop space, have you observed the same? How have you responded?

- How would your strategy shift if AI led to less seat count within FDS's customer base? How much productivity upside could FDS unlock within its own products, and is that able to be monetized?

- Recession resilience 
- How has FDS historically performed in a recession? Assess how you think FDS would likely perform in a recession? Is there anything more to a downturn playbook beyond pulling back on variable compensation, discretionary spending?

- Margins 
- Puts and takes to FY25 margins? How much room left is there for more efficiencies or is expansion driven by operating leverage from here? Given the high growth in technology costs, how do you plan to manage growth in other expense buckets to allow for continued margin expansion?

- AI for costs 
- How material of a benefit could AI be re: unlocking margin expansion?

- Pitch Creator & recent M&A 
- Logic behind Irwin, Logolntern and LiquidityBook acquisitions? How is testing and uptake for Pitch Creator? Current and expected future priority areas for investment? What are the key trends informing strategic investments to drive growth

- Provide an update on CUSIP's performance and any future initiatives there? How would CUSIP perform in a downturn?

- Cobalt 
- How are Cobalt deals trending & contributing to the pipeline?

- Content 
- Where are you focusing content collection the most? Update on Deep Sector?

- M-T Outlook 
- Does the new CEO own the M-T outlook provided by the prior CEO, or will it be revised? For the MSD-HSD forecasted ASV growth at your 2024 IR day, how do you plan on achieving since pricing and customer environment is different than when FDS previously grew HSD? Break down the growth between pricing, upsell, new logos, better retention, etc. to achieve HSD?

- Inst'l Buy-Side +MSD target 
- More mature business, how to think about growth drivers here given less end market growth? How much of your ASV is back/mid-office vs. front office? How do you plan to drive deeper into front office workflows? Competitive dynamics? Describe the managed services focus, and why that won't lead to margin degradation?

- Dealmakers +HSD target 
- Desktop user count a key driver, how does user count impact your revenue? What are some initiatives that FDS has in place to accelerate in this space, which can be competitive? Is buy-side becoming a bigger part of the mix, and if so, how much? And same for corporates?

- Wealth +LDD target 
- Discuss the pipeline for larger contract wins. How should we think about addressable market opportunity? Does this business naturally come at lower margin given the price point? Competitive dynamics here?

- Longer-term strategy with CGS? And same for partnerships, especially within Fintech/AI?

- Strategic partnerships 
- Could you provide an update on the strategic partnership to integrate Portware (execution management system) with BlackRock's Aladdin platform? What are the high-level benefits of this and other partnerships?

- Technology 
- +15% medium-term CAGR for technology costs, what all are you getting from this sizable ramp in technology investments? More color on efforts to build out API suite, AI/ML/GenAI capabilities, and shift to public cloud. How does FDS think about the ROI on these investments?

- Capital Allocation 
- Thoughts on buybacks vs. dividend vs. M&A right now?

- M&A 
- What end markets/products/etc. would you be looking for? More acquisition activity in recent quarters than FDS has ever done, is this a change in approach? Is becoming more proprietary a goal of your M&A strategy?

Talk about how FA's AI capabilities span both customer-facing applications (enhanced Profile Advantage experiences, faster external data review, advanced analytics) and internal operational functions (increased task automation, enhanced reporting, AI tools leveraging proprietary data). What is the \(\sim\) 130M annual R&D (substantially exceeding many comp.'s total revenue) expense spent on? How does this support continuous AI innovation? What about the dedicated tech hub in Poland? Talk about FA's 850+ product & tech experts distributed across 90+ agile pods globally, with eight full-stack innovation pods specifically dedicated to AI development and product innovation. - Tariff Risks? We note CTAS has reiterated the ability of its world class global supply chain to handle any changes 
- pointing out that \(90\%\) of its products are dual sourced and geographically diverse too; with the amortization of costs over time giving the company the ability to pivot as needed. And to be clear, CTAS understands the risks to regions like Canada, Mexico and China 
- i.e. it is well prepared to navigate.

- End markets 
- On its F4Q25 call, CTAS said it saw "no real weakness whatsoever" in the marketplace and commented that "we have some customers that are absolutely thriving in this environment. Some are dealing with input cost challenges. But the net-net is, our customer base is still performing well, and we think that we're in a good position there. Keep in mind, \(70\%\) of our customer base are in the services providing sector, \(30\%\) in the goods producing. But we 
- so from an adds/stops standpoint, we think we're in a good spot." What were you/what are you seeing across segments, verticals for F1Q26 and through reporting?

- Macro 
- How would you characterize the macro now? What are the impacts of a still uncertain rate path policy, despite apparent increasing likelihood of a cut at the September meeting? Is inflation persisting? GDP coming in lower than expectations? Is what you are seeing from an add stops standpoint reconcile to macro-economic reports on the Jobs market and consumer confidence?

- Current demand/outlook 
- Any particular verticals or regions within the US to call out? Any changes in customer behavior or the selling environment?

- Supply chain constraints, inflation, and labor challenges 
- had broadly eased before the Trump Administration's announcement of tariffs on Liberation Day. During the midst of, and out of, the Covid pandemic, CTAS had been highly effective at managing these types of challenges. Can you please provide an update on each of these and unpack the cost components? What is CTAS' outlook on all of these? What was energy as a % of revenues. CTAS still benefiting from having been proactive in wage increases and other employee initiatives? How about automation initiatives: real time centralized dashboard, inventory optimization? What makes CTAS' "world class" supply chain management a competitive differentiator; what about the fact that most products sourced are unique to CTAS and that \(

do CTAS's ongoing partnerships with Verizon, Google and SAP, make employee- partners' jobs easier and get the right products to customers faster and improve customer experience and positively impact margin profile. What is the latest on tech innovation and automation fronts - perhaps specifically speak to these strategic partnerships with SAP, Google, and Verizon and also Smart Truck? How will investing in these initiatives drive operational efficiencies and benefit margins and what is the anticipated timing of this? Can you please shed some light on Cintas Corporation and Lemongrass Complete Major SAP Migration to Google Cloud with Minimal Downtime, a project that - according to CTAS - will deliver "lower overhead costs and a faster, more secure and stable data management platform with LCP Migrate" (and also eventually give them access to Google's AI platform and capabilities). Verizon allows CTAS to take that data and make it mobile, to have more info at their fingertips to answer questions right away. How is the new product pipeline?
- Performance in a recession? - (See Cintas Corp.: Highlighting potential resiliency, for detailed analysis 04/21/25)

- How has CTAS historically performed during downturns? Reminder that CTAS has grown in 54 out of 56 years; with the only two years of decline 2009 (-2.4% rentals growth; -4.4% total) & 2010 (-6.8% rentals growth; -7.6% total).

- When the customer base is challenged with staffing, rising wages, inflation and more cost focused in a period of economic uncertainty - this dynamic drives growth for CTAS. If and when you do start to see signs of weakness, what are the levers CTAS can pull?

- Also, CTAS had previously said - should the economy affect customers in a negative manner, "we'll be prepared to pivot and manage our cost structure appropriately. And we're planning on being successful in whatever the economic environment brings to us." What are the cost initiatives CTAS can undertake?

- CTAS has stated that it expected new business will be attractive in any economic environment. What would the drivers of sales in a recession be? "CTAS not always asking for new spend, just direct the spend to us." Explain how CTAS isn't exactly as levered to customer headcount as one may think.

- CFO transition a surprise, but not a concern, 04/04/25 - in our view, CFO Mike Hansen has been instrumental to the CTAS story for sure, but the CEO transition announced 4/4/25 should be seamless and doesn't impact the investment thesis. Why after a successful 30-year career and storied 10-year run as CFO was it time for the CFO to move on? Current Rental Division President Scott Garula was named as successor and is a nearly 30-year veteran himself - having held various leadership positions, including key Finance roles and was President of First Aid, Fire & Safety prior to serving as President of the Rental Division. The new CFO has a strong track record in financial management and operational leadership and brings strength in strategy as a skill. How is the transition going? What impact does the new CFO hope to have on CTAS in this next step in his career? Could you please assess bench strength for CEO?

- F'26 E Guidance - What did F'26E guidance contemplate in terms of growth & margins by business? What is the expected contribution from M&A? Puts & takes to revenues & earnings guidance? Is Fire Protection SAP implementation expected to impact margins 55-60 bps for Fire and 15-20 bps total company? For reference, CTAS said "We certainly expect that our rental business will be similar (to the 7% organic for F'25), and our fire and first aid businesses be in the double-digit area." conservative). Also, CTAS commented that its guide contemplated the following: some additional input expense, investment initiatives, and historical pricing. What is CTAS outlook?

- Culture 
- CTAS repeatedly comments on culture as their key differentiator. Last year at Miami ISC (see Cintas Corp.: Conference takeaways, 02/21/24) the COO articulated how they have taken time to document culture, to be very intentional speaking about it in leadership, and modeling it in decision making. The 3 dimensions of CTAS's culture as communicated by the company (1. Principle objective, 2. Corporate character, and 3. Management system) is the key driver of their superior execution, including attracting talent. It was also brought up \(\sim 10x\) on the F3Q24 earnings call 
- as a driver of top line, margin, innovation & execution. Help us really appreciate your culture and how it is a differentiator, given the COO's comment that "Culture, how we run our business, the expectations we have, the intensity of which we run it and the focus, culture of the organization where they're focused on driving those results, providing a better experience for our customers and providing a better experience for our employee partners. Our culture is such that we are constantly innovating and pushing ourselves to be 
- to provide the best products and services."

Is this a normalized revenue mix?

- FY'25 was CTAS's largest year of M&A activity in "almost 20 years" ex. '17 when it acquired G&K (and the pipeline remains robust across all segments); it again grew dividends, and was opportunistic with buybacks.

- flat) See Cintas Corp.: Back to fundamentals

- Large, Highly Fragmented Addressable Market; Persistent Center Supply Shortages; Growing and Stable Subsidy Funding; Insufficient "Universal" Pre-K Programs Increase Demand for Flexible Private Providers; Families from Various Socio-Economic Backgrounds Struggle to Balance Child Care Responsibilities and Accessibility; Increasing Demand for Child Care Employer Benefits Driving B2B Growth? What is evidence, proof points of KLC's positioning & participation.? Anything else to note as far as the following drivers of growth: secular market tailwinds, structural industry shifts to operators of scale, strategic platform investments?

- Differentiators 
- How is KLC child development and family experience differentiated in terms of people & engagement; educational excellence; health & safety; and operations & growth? What about int terms of curriculum/outcomes and accreditation/overall quality? How is the value proposition differentiated in addressing challenges accessing high-quality ECE?

- GTM channels 
- Talk about your GTM channels and how they serve families where they are: in their neighborhoods, at places of work, and at schools. What is the U.S. KCLC exposure by regions, which states have the largest concentrations (on a relative basis)? What about for Crème? Can you talk about your solutions for employers to offer flexible solutions to their employees? What are avg. tuition benefits? How many on-site centers does KLC have? For context, as of '23, KLC had 700+ relationships with employers, 70+ on-site employer-sponsored centers, tuition benefits comprised 20% of revenues. What are the capex return/revenue/margin profiles for cost plus + KLC P&L models? What are your back-up care options? What is the growth strategy for Champions (B&A School care) - drive existing site enrollment, new school district partnerships, leveraging client advocates, summer camp expansion?

- Tech investments 
- What were the \(\sim\) 35M in tech investments (From '21 - through - mid-'24) for; how did they enhance center productivity & family experience?

- Occupancy growth 
- Talk about historical success at driving occupancy growth and the significant potential for occupancy growth within the fleet, and respective quintiles. What are most recent trends in your quintiles, and how does this compare to 2019 & 2023? What are strategic initiatives to drive same-center occupancy? What levels of occupancy do your margin targets contemplate?

- Pricing 
- Talk about your price increase history and confidence ability to price going forward? Explain the waterfall pricing dynamics through which as students progress through grades, prices naturally come down for parents, even as increases in tuition are implemented.

- NCO 
- what is the evaluation and integration process for new center openings and acquisitions; what are typical timelines, and economics? What is the track record? What are typical NCO economics 
- capital outlay & pre-opening costs, how does occupancy progress, what is the typical payback period, and the EBITDA ramp?

- Margin drivers 
- Explain the existing fleet embedded growth and margin expansion opportunity. How does every 2% of increased occupancy drive +1% in annual EBITDA margins, all else being equal? How does the platform approach create operating leverage? What are cost of service components (-51% labor, -12% rent, -15% others, how have these trended? What about salaries & fringe benefits and other G&A?

- Tuition to wage rate spread 
- What are historical & anticipated tuition and wage rate increases, spreads and drivers? What is KLC's approach to center level compensation? How do you expect these to trend?

- 2Q'25E/FY25E Guidance 
- What does guidance contemplate in terms of:

- What is expected revenue growth, GP Margin, Adj. EBITDA margin & leverage targets?  
- Any change to the up or downside from your expected LT Financial Framework (bulleted below)?  
- +2% from occupancy growth. What are KLC's expectations for same center occupancy for '26E-28E?  
- 3-4% pricing power  
- 1-2% B2B Employer & B&A School Sites  
- 1% NCO  
- 1% Disciplined M&A

- Capex 
- How should we think about growth capex and maintenance capex as a % of revenues?

- FCF 
- How should we think about normalized FCF conversion post the impact of Covid related funds?

- Capital allocation priorities 
- What are KLC's priorities and levers for capital allocation? Is it continued investment in organic growth, careful evaluation of strategic acquisitions that enhance credit profile of the business? What about expanding the footprint in the premium market?

- Leverage 
- Is KLC on track for the reducing leverage to 3.3x within 18 months of IPO? KLC upsized its revolver by \(22.5M in early '25 to support growth, and expects leverage to remain around the target range as profitability expands. Interest expense has declined materially post-IPO \~\)20M for 2Q'25 vs. \(44M a year ago, with a July 1 repricing expected to save an additional \~\)5M annually.

- M&A 
- How were the Rainbow (150 centers in Aug. '18) and Crème (44 centers in Oct. '22) acquisitions transformational? What have historic acquisition multiples been? What are more recent multiples and how are current multiples? What is the strategic process to having acquired over 230+ centers in the \~ 6 yrs into 3Q'24? What are the evaluation criteria for potential acquisitions? How are they sourced? In 1H'25, KinderCare did 8 NCOs and completed 14 tuck-ins; for "a little under" \(15 million, fully funded by\) 76M of FCF generated in the first half. For 2025, management guides to \(85 - \$95 million of free cash flow and\) 130-
\(135 million of CapEx (about 40\% maintenance / 60\% growth), supporting visibility to accelerate NCOs to the mid- 20s per year in 2026 and beyond\)
